Welcome to Tic-Tac-Tornadoes!
In this game, the goal is to get a 5-in-a-row of pieces on a 7 by 7 board.
However, both sides can play 3 Tornadoes and 2 Tornado Cancels.
Tornadoes change every piece of the opposing player in their row or column to a ghost.
Ghosts are effectively blank pieces, but they turn back into pieces if the Tornado's effect is lifted (explained below).
Tornado cancels cancel a tornado, replacing it with a blocked square that does nothing.
If there are two tornadoes in the same row or column, neither affects the area between them and they block each other's effect beyond them.
Tornadoes do not count as pieces, but they take up space.
Have fun!
